Articles.Content:
The colours are expected, as the IVA isn't finished, so there aren't any textures. Are you using RPM for IVA? Nothing really works without it.

This. You need RPM to get anything out of the IVA. The colors are like that to help me differentiate different surfaces when working in unity. You don't want me to texture this thing, trust me.

As far as the engines go, Illumination should be pretty easy, just an emissive effect in unity. The engines are supposed to have two modes, one for chemical rockets, and another being the plasma jets. The one til027 showed would be the plasma jets. A VASIMR looks like this:

which still has an exhaust plume, however subtle it may be. I'm going to figure out how to make effects, and then we'll have some appropriate engine exhaust. Until then, just use your imagination!

As far as the engines go, Illumination should be pretty easy, just an emissive effect in unity. The engines are supposed to have two modes, one for chemical rockets, and another being the plasma jets. The one til027 showed would be the plasma jets. A VASIMR looks like this:

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/3/36/VX-200_operation_full_power.jpg/300px-VX-200_operation_full_power.jpg

which still has an exhaust plume, however subtle it may be. I'm going to figure out how to make effects, and then we'll have some appropriate engine exhaust. Until then, just use your imagination!

I imagine you're correct and the exhaust would just be invisible in any sort of light.

Does anyone have a craft file for the ranger?

- - - Updated - - -

Or a FAR CFG for the ranger body?
beautiful, just beautiful

Not sure if this has already been established, but the reason an S5 is used to launch from Earth is because both Rangers are being launched at once (and to conserve fuel on the Rangers for planetary landing/etc). I'm assuming there is some sort of fairing that covers the open area between them while on the booster since it's clear that the windows are uncovered during launch, but they are launched with their heat shield sides facing each other. It's not explained at all in the movie, but I'm thinking how this works is that there is an extending non-crew tunnel docking port / magnet plate of some kind between the rear landing gear of each that tie them together for launch and initial docking to Endurance, seen in these two pictures:

^ (retracted) the large protruded plate section between the gear

^ the connectors extended during the initial docking scene.

When the connectors are fully extended, both the Rangers' docking ports would line up with their respective ports on Endurance. When both are docked, the connectors are retracted. These connectors probably have some relays between them so when both Rangers are in launch configuration they are essentially controlled as a single spacecraft.

http://i.imgur.com/9HBdf0Q.jpg

beautiful, just beautiful

The Endurance is almost complete!

If we were to use tweakscale, or even redistribute parts and rescale them, we could make a rocket that is much larger in diameter, so that we could fit both in the configuration in the movie. The fairing piece that goes on top shouldn't be too hard to make honestly. Just make it with two nodes parallel to the ranger ports, so you can put two docking ports or decouplers on the fairing, and then attach the rangers. That would require a 5m stack for the top stage, meaning 6.25+ for the main and second stage. Might be a bit much, but it's an option.
